Imagine that you are in a situation where you are debating someone face to face or you are arguing with someone. You KNOW that you're right and that your opponent is wrong, but your opponent doesn't want to accept the fact that they're wrong. They are saying a load of bull. What techniques do you use to fight against them to tell them that they are wrong?
 
 What if they know that they are wrong and they're lying but still don't want to admit it?
 
 Please give some ideas!!

post_info.post_title: Face to Face Debating or Arguing

Depends entirely on the subject and whether there is/isn't an audience imo.
 
 -Wez

Once you've presented your argument, and backed it up with evidence and reasoning, and, despite exhortation, they still don't want to see it, isn't life too short to waste time on time-wasters? Pearls (of wisdom) before swine and all that. emoticon_xgood
